result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Carlos Colon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per order signed 07-18-2017 sentence modified to allow Huber privileges for work release.

Ordered that Mr. Juan Colon's one year house of correction sentence be modified to allow for Huber privileges for work release signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant attorney Parent.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michael J. Hanrahan, Br. 4, calendar successor, for review. spc
MOTION TO MODIFY SENTENCE TO INCLUDE HUBER PRIVILEGES.

Defendant Juan Carlos Colon in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Per agent request, due to case recently being transferred to new agent, case rescheduled for Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.

Defendant Juan Carlos Colon in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Defendant Juan Carlos Colon in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 45 days of the condition time; to begin from 10/23/2016; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. Case remains set for Probation Review on 1/6/2017 in branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Per agent request, case scheduled for Probation Review Hearing on 10/28/2016.

Defendant Juan Carlos Colon in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton. Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties, Adrian L., and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 1 YEAR in the House of Correction, with credit for 43 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 90 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management as determined by the agent.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim A.L. However, defendant must be drug and alcohol free to remain in the home. If defendant tests positive, court orders a straight no contact order.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay the DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Crime VIctim Impact Statement

Probation Review Hearing in Branch 24  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court reduced bail to $200.00 total.
All other conditions remains in effect.

Defendant Juan Carlos Colon in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Juan Carlos Colon in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case 
for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

 
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 


Court ordered Jury trial scheduled for 10-17-2016 at 8:30am, Vacated. Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
